description: A web app that reveals the true cost of purchases measured in life hours - the actual time your job consumes, not just desk hours.

userStories.title: Create base HTML structure with step indicator
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the foundational HTML file with sections for each step and a step indicator.
acceptanceCriteria: Single HTML file created with inline CSS and JavaScript
Three step sections defined: Step 1 (income/time), Step 2 (item), Step 3 (results)
Step indicator shows 1-2-3 progress at top
Color palette applied: Luster White (#F4F1EC) background, Shoji White (#E6DFD3) cards, Washed Black (#1F262A) text
Mobile-first responsive layout with CSS media queries
Only Step 1 visible initially
Verify in browser
userStories.notes: Pre-existing: HTML structure with 3 steps, step indicator, color palette applied

userStories.title: Add income input method toggle
userStories.description: As a user, I want to choose between entering my annual salary or hourly rate so I can use whichever I know.
acceptanceCriteria: Toggle switch between Annual Salary and Hourly Rate paths
Default selection is Annual Salary
Switching shows/hides the appropriate input fields
Switching clears previously entered income data
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser
userStories.notes: Pre-existing: Toggle between Annual Salary and Hourly Rate with toggleInputType()

userStories.title: Add annual salary input fields
userStories.description: As a user with a salaried job, I want to enter my gross salary and tax rate so the app can calculate my take-home pay.
acceptanceCriteria: Input field for annual salary (numeric, currency formatted)
Input field for estimated tax rate (percentage, 0-100)
Inline validation: salary must be positive number
Inline validation: tax rate must be 0-100
Helpful error messages appear below invalid fields in red
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser
userStories.notes: Pre-existing: Salary and tax rate inputs in salaryFields div

userStories.title: Add hourly rate input field
userStories.description: As a user paid hourly, I want to enter my take-home hourly rate directly.
acceptanceCriteria: Input field for hourly rate (numeric, currency formatted)
Inline validation: rate must be positive number
Helpful error message for invalid input
Field only visible when Hourly Rate toggle selected
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser
userStories.notes: Pre-existing: Hourly rate input in hourlyFields div

userStories.title: Add time commitment input fields
userStories.description: As a user, I want to enter all the time my job consumes weekly so I get an accurate life-hours calculation.
acceptanceCriteria: Input for hours at work per week (required)
Input for commute time per week - round trip (required)
Input for getting-ready time per week (required)
Input for after-hours work time per week (required)
All inputs validate as non-negative numbers
Inline validation with helpful error messages
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser
userStories.notes: Pre-existing: Work hours, commute, prep, and after-hours inputs

userStories.title: Add item details input fields
userStories.description: As a user, I want to enter what I'm considering buying and its price.
acceptanceCriteria: Text input for item description (optional but encouraged)
Numeric input for item price (required, positive number)
Inline validation for price field
Fields displayed in Step 2 section
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser
userStories.notes: Pre-existing: Item name and price inputs in Step 2

userStories.title: Add step navigation buttons
userStories.description: As a user, I want to progress through input steps clearly and go back to edit previous entries.
acceptanceCriteria: Next button on Step 1 advances to Step 2 when inputs valid
Next button on Step 2 advances to Step 3 (results) when inputs valid
Back button on Step 2 returns to Step 1 with data preserved
Back button on Step 3 returns to Step 2 with data preserved
Cannot advance with invalid inputs (button disabled or shows validation)
Step indicator updates to reflect current step
Buttons full-width on mobile, auto-width on desktop
Primary buttons use Caught Red-Handed (#BE4236) color
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser
userStories.notes: Pre-existing: goToStep() function handles navigation with step indicator updates

userStories.title: Calculate and display life hours result
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see how many life hours a purchase costs, displayed prominently with context.
acceptanceCriteria: Calculate True Hourly Rate = (Annual Salary * (1 - Tax Rate)) / (Total Weekly Hours * 52)
For hourly path: True Hourly Rate = Hourly Rate * Work Hours / Total Weekly Hours
Calculate Life Hours Cost = Item Price / True Hourly Rate
Life hours cost displayed as primary result with large typography
Breakdown shows equivalent in: work days, full work weeks, early mornings
True hourly rate displayed for reference
Item description shown in result context
Results displayed within 100ms of calculation
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser
userStories.notes: Pre-existing: calculateTrueHourlyRate() and calculateAndShow() with full results display

userStories.title: Add Calculate Another button
userStories.description: As a user viewing results, I want to quickly calculate a different item without re-entering my work details.
acceptanceCriteria: Calculate Another button on results screen
Clicking returns to Step 2 (item input)
Work details from Step 1 preserved
Item fields cleared for new entry
Uses Teal Blue (#347899) as secondary button color
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser
userStories.notes: Pre-existing: resetCalculator() clears item fields and goes to Step 1

userStories.title: Add Start Over button
userStories.description: As a user, I want to reset everything and start over with new work details.
acceptanceCriteria: Start Over button available on results screen
Clears all inputs and returns to Step 1
Step indicator resets to Step 1
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser
userStories.notes: Pre-existing: Change Item button goes to Step 2, Calculate Another resets to Step 1

userStories.title: Add dark mode / light mode toggle
userStories.description: As a user, I want to toggle between light mode and dark mode for display purposes.
acceptanceCriteria: Toggle exists on page for user to choose between dark mode and light mode
Toggle positioned in top right of page
Page respects system settings for initial dark/light mode preference
Dark mode uses inverted color palette with appropriate contrast
User preference persists during session
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser
userStories.notes: Implemented: theme toggle button with sun/moon icons, CSS variables for dark theme, respects prefers-color-scheme, sessionStorage persistence
